content.description:
A line of bolts up a difficult-appearing, smooth section of rock to the left of a shallow, broken, jumbled dihedral.

The obvious ascent is made in and around the dihedral just to the right of the bolt line and keeps the grade low.

If you were so inclined you could contrive to climb the smooth face on the bolt line at what looks to be low 5.12.
content.location: In west-facing the alcove around the right corner from the main, north-facing wall. This is the second-from left bolted line in the alcove.

content.description:
Vertical start onto liebacking slabbiness, a few bolts of slabbery, followed by dihedral climbing into the steep crux.

Start up a short, vertical section and get onto the lower-angled, slabby rock above. Continue on the left side of the slabby bit for a few bolts, until you have to cross the slab into the shallow corner on the right.

At this point the line steepens a bit until it is slightly overhanging through the last bolt to the anchors.
content.location: The left-most line on the main wall. Heads up the obvious slabby section into the dihedral above.

content.description:
Stem up the dihedral for a couple of bolts, head left to the arete, and then around the fourth bolt make a balancy, tenuous rightward traverse into the corner.

Up the corner for two bolts, then left again onto the face. The angle eases slightly after a bit, and then it's edges to the anchors.
content.location: The right most route in the alcove around the corner from the main face (still on the left side of the scree field).

content.description:
Start up in the corner to the left of the slabby face. After the third or fourth bolt leave the relative comfort of the wide corner crack and transition onto the face. Climb up and right through occasionally tenuous moves to a narrow ledge on the arete at the right of the slabby face.

Make a move or two upward into the steepening territory above you and get established on the arete. Move quickly as the pump starts to build and follow the arete up and left, with a bit of footwork and muscle required right at the end.
content.location: On the right section of the north-facing main wall this line starts in the corner and heads across the face to the arete.

content.description:
A truly enjoyable route up slighty-less than vertical (mostly) rock with technical, tricky movement.

None of the movement is particularly strenuous on its own but the route is continuous enough that the pump creeps up on you and peaks right about where the trickiest, steepest movement is required.

Start up on some big holds along the arete to the first bolt, then head left to a shallow, right-facing corner and up.

Note that the anchors and last bolt aren't very visible near the top where the angle lessens (and the holds become sparser) and you may be tempted to traverse left to the anchors of the .12c to the left.
content.location: On the main, north-facing wall. Climbs just left of an arete. Shares the first bolt with the route that climbs the arete.
